**Plasma Beam** is a level 6 [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")/[Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") spell. This spell fires two inaccurate bolts - a [fire](/Fire "Fire") bolt, and an [electricity](/Electricity "Electricity") bolt - directed at the furthest enemy in range.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Gallery](#Gallery)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Fires two penetrating bolts at the furthest enemy in [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight"). If there are multiple enemies at the same distance, the target is randomly chosen. Both bolts will always be aimed at the same target.

Bolts follow the same trajectory as any regular projectile. It's treated as if you aimed directly at the intended target, so there will always be one (and only one) possible path per target. You can view possible paths by targeting this spell.

The electric bolt will ignore 1/2 of the target's [AC](/AC "AC"), as a property of `BEAM_ELEC` damage. The fire bolt is fully affected by AC. This means that Plasma Beam, as a whole, is impacted x1.5 by AC than usual.

## Strategy

Awkward schooling, but a powerful spell. At 50 [spellpower](/Spellpower "Spellpower"), this spell deals 2 x 1d41 damage (avg. 42). [Bombard](/Bombard "Bombard"), another level 6 spell, would deal 9d5 (avg. 27) to a single target. While Bombard has multiple advantages (more [accurate](/To-hit "To-hit"), quieter, can be aimed, irresistible damage, checks AC only once), this spell isn't weak by any means. As this spell is [loud](/Noise "Noise"), beware of enemies you'll attract.

With clever maneuvering to funnel enemies through hallways and bottlenecks, the spell's quirk of attacking its farthest enemy becomes a powerful advantage, as you are also striking all interposed enemies.

[Staves](/Staff "Staff") of fire and air greatly enhance the spell's destructive power. The [Elemental Staff](/Elemental_Staff "Elemental Staff"), because it enhances *both* schools, has twice the beneficial effect and should be highly prized.

## Gallery

- [![](/images/thumb/0/07/Plasma_beam_targeting.png/400px-Plasma_beam_targeting.png)](/File:Plasma_beam_targeting.png)

  Plasma Beam will always take the **leftmost** path.  
  (It is always aimed directly at the target)

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Plasma Beam's range depended on your [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power") (3 at 0 power, 10 at 200 power).
- Plasma Beam was added in [0.30](/0.30 "0.30").
